detaileddescription.para: This page lists the facilities provided by GoogleTest for writing test programs. To use them, include the header gtest/gtest.h.

sect1.title: Macros
sect1.para: GoogleTest defines the following macros for writing tests.

sect2.title: TEST
sect2.para: Defines an individual test named TestName in the test suite TestSuiteName, consisting of the given statements.
Both arguments TestSuiteName and TestName must be valid C++ identifiers and must not contain underscores (_). Tests in different test suites can have the same individual name.
The statements within the test body can be any code under test. Assertions used within the test body determine the outcome of the test.

sect2.title: TEST_F
sect2.para: Defines an individual test named TestName that uses the test fixture class TestFixtureName. The test suite name is TestFixtureName.
Both arguments TestFixtureName and TestName must be valid C++ identifiers and must not contain underscores (_). TestFixtureName must be the name of a test fixture class—see Test Fixtures.
The statements within the test body can be any code under test. Assertions used within the test body determine the outcome of the test.

sect2.title: TEST_P
sect2.para: Defines an individual value-parameterized test named TestName that uses the test fixture class TestFixtureName. The test suite name is TestFixtureName.

Both arguments TestFixtureName and TestName must be valid C++ identifiers and must not contain underscores (_). TestFixtureName must be the name of a value-parameterized test fixture class—see Value-Parameterized Tests.
The statements within the test body can be any code under test. Within the test body, the test parameter can be accessed with the GetParam() function (see `WithParamInterface`). For example:
Assertions used within the test body determine the outcome of the test.
See also `INSTANTIATE_TEST_SUITE_P`.

sect2.title: INSTANTIATE_TEST_SUITE_P
sect2.para: INSTANTIATE_TEST_SUITE_P(*InstantiationName*,*TestSuiteName*,*param_generator*) \ INSTANTIATE_TEST_SUITE_P(*InstantiationName*,*TestSuiteName*,*param_generator*,*name_generator*)
Instantiates the value-parameterized test suite TestSuiteName (defined with `TEST_P`).

The argument InstantiationName is a unique name for the instantiation of the test suite, to distinguish between multiple instantiations. In test output, the instantiation name is added as a prefix to the test suite name TestSuiteName.
The argument param_generator is one of the following GoogleTest-provided functions that generate the test parameters, all defined in the testing namespace:

Parameter Generator
Behavior
Range(begin, end [, step])
Yields values {begin, begin+step, begin+step+step, ...}. The values do not include end. step defaults to 1.
Values(v1, v2, ..., vN)
Yields values {v1, v2, ..., vN}.
ValuesIn(container) or ValuesIn(begin,end)
Yields values from a C-style array, an STL-style container, or an iterator range [begin, end).
Bool()
Yields sequence {false, true}.
Combine(g1, g2, ..., gN)
Yields as std::tuple n-tuples all combinations (Cartesian product) of the values generated by the given n generators g1, g2, ..., gN.
ConvertGenerator<T>(g)
Yields values generated by generator g, static_cast to T.
The optional last argument name_generator is a function or functor that generates custom test name suffixes based on the test parameters. The function must accept an argument of type `TestParamInfo<class ParamType>` and return a std::string. The test name suffix can only contain alphanumeric characters and underscores. GoogleTest provides `PrintToStringParamName`, or a custom function can be used for more control:
For more information, see Value-Parameterized Tests.
See also `GTEST_ALLOW_UNINSTANTIATED_PARAMETERIZED_TEST`.

sect2.title: TYPED_TEST_SUITE
sect2.para: TYPED_TEST_SUITE(*TestFixtureName*,*Types*)
Defines a typed test suite based on the test fixture TestFixtureName. The test suite name is TestFixtureName.
The argument TestFixtureName is a fixture class template, parameterized by a type, for example:
The argument Types is a `Types` object representing the list of types to run the tests on, for example:
The type alias (using or typedef) is necessary for the TYPED_TEST_SUITE macro to parse correctly.
See also `TYPED_TEST` and Typed Tests for more information.

sect2.title: TYPED_TEST
sect2.para: Defines an individual typed test named TestName in the typed test suite TestSuiteName. The test suite must be defined with `TYPED_TEST_SUITE`.
Within the test body, the special name TypeParam refers to the type parameter, and TestFixture refers to the fixture class. See the following example:
For more information, see Typed Tests.

sect2.title: TYPED_TEST_SUITE_P
sect2.para: TYPED_TEST_SUITE_P(*TestFixtureName*)
Defines a type-parameterized test suite based on the test fixture TestFixtureName. The test suite name is TestFixtureName.
The argument TestFixtureName is a fixture class template, parameterized by a type. See `TYPED_TEST_SUITE` for an example.
See also `TYPED_TEST_P` and Type-Parameterized Tests for more information.

sect2.title: TYPED_TEST_P
sect2.para: Defines an individual type-parameterized test named TestName in the type-parameterized test suite TestSuiteName. The test suite must be defined with `TYPED_TEST_SUITE_P`.
Within the test body, the special name TypeParam refers to the type parameter, and TestFixture refers to the fixture class. See `TYPED_TEST` for an example.
See also `REGISTER_TYPED_TEST_SUITE_P` and Type-Parameterized Tests for more information.

sect2.title: REGISTER_TYPED_TEST_SUITE_P
sect2.para: REGISTER_TYPED_TEST_SUITE_P(*TestSuiteName*,*TestNames...*)
Registers the type-parameterized tests TestNames... of the test suite TestSuiteName. The test suite and tests must be defined with `TYPED_TEST_SUITE_P` and `TYPED_TEST_P`.
For example:
See also `INSTANTIATE_TYPED_TEST_SUITE_P` and Type-Parameterized Tests for more information.

sect2.title: INSTANTIATE_TYPED_TEST_SUITE_P
sect2.para: INSTANTIATE_TYPED_TEST_SUITE_P(*InstantiationName*,*TestSuiteName*,*Types*)
Instantiates the type-parameterized test suite TestSuiteName. The test suite must be registered with `REGISTER_TYPED_TEST_SUITE_P`.

The argument InstantiationName is a unique name for the instantiation of the test suite, to distinguish between multiple instantiations. In test output, the instantiation name is added as a prefix to the test suite name TestSuiteName.
The argument Types is a `Types` object representing the list of types to run the tests on, for example:
The type alias (using or typedef) is necessary for the INSTANTIATE_TYPED_TEST_SUITE_P macro to parse correctly.
For more information, see Type-Parameterized Tests.

sect2.title: FRIEND_TEST
sect2.para: FRIEND_TEST(*TestSuiteName*,*TestName*)
Within a class body, declares an individual test as a friend of the class, enabling the test to access private class members.
If the class is defined in a namespace, then in order to be friends of the class, test fixtures and tests must be defined in the exact same namespace, without inline or anonymous namespaces.
For example, if the class definition looks like the following:
Then the test code should look like:
See Testing Private Code for more information.

sect2.title: SCOPED_TRACE
sect2.para: SCOPED_TRACE(*message*)
Causes the current file name, line number, and the given message message to be added to the failure message for each assertion failure that occurs in the scope.
For more information, see Adding Traces to Assertions.
See also the `ScopedTrace` class.

sect2.title: GTEST_SKIP
sect2.para: Prevents further test execution at runtime.

Can be used in individual test cases or in the SetUp() methods of test environments or test fixtures (classes derived from the `Environment` or `Test` classes). If used in a global test environment SetUp() method, it skips all tests in the test program. If used in a test fixture SetUp() method, it skips all tests in the corresponding test suite.
Similar to assertions, GTEST_SKIP allows streaming a custom message into it.
See Skipping Test Execution for more information.

sect2.title: GTEST_ALLOW_UNINSTANTIATED_PARAMETERIZED_TEST
sect2.para: GTEST_ALLOW_UNINSTANTIATED_PARAMETERIZED_TEST(*TestSuiteName*)
Allows the value-parameterized test suite TestSuiteName to be uninstantiated.

By default, every `TEST_P` call without a corresponding `INSTANTIATE_TEST_SUITE_P` call causes a failing test in the test suite GoogleTestVerification. GTEST_ALLOW_UNINSTANTIATED_PARAMETERIZED_TEST suppresses this failure for the given test suite.

sect1.title: Classes and types
sect1.para: GoogleTest defines the following classes and types to help with writing tests.

sect2.title: AssertionResult
sect2.para: A class for indicating whether an assertion was successful.
When the assertion wasn't successful, the AssertionResult object stores a non-empty failure message that can be retrieved with the object's message() method.
To create an instance of this class, use one of the factory functions `AssertionSuccess()` or `AssertionFailure()`.

sect2.title: AssertionException
sect2.para: Exception which can be thrown from `TestEventListener::OnTestPartResult`.

sect2.title: EmptyTestEventListener
sect2.para: Provides an empty implementation of all methods in the `TestEventListener` interface, such that a subclass only needs to override the methods it cares about.

sect2.title: Environment
sect2.para: Represents a global test environment. See Global Set-Up and Tear-Down.

sect4.title: SetUp {#Environment::SetUp}
sect4.para: Override this to define how to set up the environment.

sect4.title: TearDown {#Environment::TearDown}
sect4.para: Override this to define how to tear down the environment.

sect2.title: ScopedTrace
sect2.para: An instance of this class causes a trace to be included in every test failure message generated by code in the scope of the lifetime of the ScopedTrace instance. The effect is undone with the destruction of the instance.
The ScopedTrace constructor has the following form:
Example usage:
The resulting trace includes the given source file path and line number, and the given message. The message argument can be anything streamable to std::ostream.
See also `SCOPED_TRACE`.

sect2.title: Test
sect2.para: The abstract class that all tests inherit from. Test is not copyable.

sect4.title: SetUpTestSuite {#Test::SetUpTestSuite}
sect4.para: Performs shared setup for all tests in the test suite. GoogleTest calls SetUpTestSuite() before running the first test in the test suite.

sect4.title: TearDownTestSuite {#Test::TearDownTestSuite}
sect4.para: Performs shared teardown for all tests in the test suite. GoogleTest calls TearDownTestSuite() after running the last test in the test suite.

sect4.title: HasFatalFailure {#Test::HasFatalFailure}
sect4.para: Returns true if and only if the current test has a fatal failure.

sect4.title: HasNonfatalFailure {#Test::HasNonfatalFailure}
sect4.para: Returns true if and only if the current test has a nonfatal failure.

sect4.title: HasFailure {#Test::HasFailure}
sect4.para: Returns true if and only if the current test has any failure, either fatal or nonfatal.

sect4.title: IsSkipped {#Test::IsSkipped}
sect4.para: Returns true if and only if the current test was skipped.

sect4.title: RecordProperty {#Test::RecordProperty}
sect4.para: static void Test::RecordProperty(const std::string& key, const std::string& value) \ static void Test::RecordProperty(const std::string& key, int value)
Logs a property for the current test, test suite, or entire invocation of the test program. Only the last value for a given key is logged.
The key must be a valid XML attribute name, and cannot conflict with the ones already used by GoogleTest (name, file, line, status, time, classname, type_param, and value_param).
RecordProperty is public static so it can be called from utility functions that are not members of the test fixture.

Calls to RecordProperty made during the lifespan of the test (from the moment its constructor starts to the moment its destructor finishes) are output in XML as attributes of the <testcase> element. Properties recorded from a fixture's SetUpTestSuite or TearDownTestSuite methods are logged as attributes of the corresponding <testsuite> element. Calls to RecordProperty made in the global context (before or after invocation of RUN_ALL_TESTS or from the SetUp/TearDown methods of registered Environment objects) are output as attributes of the <testsuites> element.

sect4.title: SetUp {#Test::SetUp}
sect4.para: Override this to perform test fixture setup. GoogleTest calls SetUp() before running each individual test.

sect4.title: TearDown {#Test::TearDown}
sect4.para: Override this to perform test fixture teardown. GoogleTest calls TearDown() after running each individual test.

sect2.title: TestWithParam
sect2.para: A convenience class which inherits from both `Test` and `WithParamInterface<T>`.

sect2.title: TestSuite
sect2.para: Represents a test suite. TestSuite is not copyable.

sect4.title: name {#TestSuite::name}
sect4.para: Gets the name of the test suite.

sect4.title: type_param {#TestSuite::type_param}
sect4.para: Returns the name of the parameter type, or NULL if this is not a typed or type-parameterized test suite. See Typed Tests and Type-Parameterized Tests.

sect4.title: should_run {#TestSuite::should_run}
sect4.para: Returns true if any test in this test suite should run.

sect4.title: successful_test_count {#TestSuite::successful_test_count}
sect4.para: Gets the number of successful tests in this test suite.

sect4.title: skipped_test_count {#TestSuite::skipped_test_count}
sect4.para: Gets the number of skipped tests in this test suite.

sect4.title: failed_test_count {#TestSuite::failed_test_count}
sect4.para: Gets the number of failed tests in this test suite.

sect4.title: reportable_disabled_test_count {#TestSuite::reportable_disabled_test_count}
sect4.para: Gets the number of disabled tests that will be reported in the XML report.

sect4.title: disabled_test_count {#TestSuite::disabled_test_count}
sect4.para: Gets the number of disabled tests in this test suite.

sect4.title: reportable_test_count {#TestSuite::reportable_test_count}
sect4.para: Gets the number of tests to be printed in the XML report.

sect4.title: test_to_run_count {#TestSuite::test_to_run_count}
sect4.para: Get the number of tests in this test suite that should run.

sect4.title: total_test_count {#TestSuite::total_test_count}
sect4.para: Gets the number of all tests in this test suite.

sect4.title: Passed {#TestSuite::Passed}
sect4.para: Returns true if and only if the test suite passed.

sect4.title: Failed {#TestSuite::Failed}
sect4.para: Returns true if and only if the test suite failed.

sect4.title: elapsed_time {#TestSuite::elapsed_time}
sect4.para: Returns the elapsed time, in milliseconds.

sect4.title: start_timestamp {#TestSuite::start_timestamp}
sect4.para: Gets the time of the test suite start, in ms from the start of the UNIX epoch.

sect4.title: GetTestInfo {#TestSuite::GetTestInfo}
sect4.para: Returns the `TestInfo` for the i-th test among all the tests. i can range from 0 to total_test_count() - 1. If i is not in that range, returns NULL.

sect4.title: ad_hoc_test_result {#TestSuite::ad_hoc_test_result}
sect4.para: Returns the `TestResult` that holds test properties recorded during execution of SetUpTestSuite and TearDownTestSuite.

sect2.title: TestInfo
sect2.para: Stores information about a test.

sect4.title: test_suite_name {#TestInfo::test_suite_name}
sect4.para: Returns the test suite name.

sect4.title: name {#TestInfo::name}
sect4.para: Returns the test name.

sect4.title: type_param {#TestInfo::type_param}
sect4.para: Returns the name of the parameter type, or NULL if this is not a typed or type-parameterized test. See Typed Tests and Type-Parameterized Tests.

sect4.title: value_param {#TestInfo::value_param}
sect4.para: Returns the text representation of the value parameter, or NULL if this is not a value-parameterized test. See Value-Parameterized Tests.

sect4.title: file {#TestInfo::file}
sect4.para: Returns the file name where this test is defined.

sect4.title: line {#TestInfo::line}
sect4.para: Returns the line where this test is defined.

sect4.title: is_in_another_shard {#TestInfo::is_in_another_shard}
sect4.para: Returns true if this test should not be run because it's in another shard.

sect4.title: should_run {#TestInfo::should_run}
sect4.para: Returns true if this test should run, that is if the test is not disabled (or it is disabled but the also_run_disabled_tests flag has been specified) and its full name matches the user-specified filter.
GoogleTest allows the user to filter the tests by their full names. Only the tests that match the filter will run. See Running a Subset of the Tests for more information.

sect4.title: is_reportable {#TestInfo::is_reportable}
sect4.para: Returns true if and only if this test will appear in the XML report.

sect4.title: result {#TestInfo::result}
sect4.para: Returns the result of the test. See `TestResult`.

sect2.title: TestParamInfo
sect2.para: Describes a parameter to a value-parameterized test. The type T is the type of the parameter.
Contains the fields param and index which hold the value of the parameter and its integer index respectively.

sect2.title: UnitTest
sect2.para: This class contains information about the test program.
UnitTest is a singleton class. The only instance is created when UnitTest::GetInstance() is first called. This instance is never deleted.
UnitTest is not copyable.

sect4.title: GetInstance {#UnitTest::GetInstance}
sect4.para: Gets the singleton UnitTest object. The first time this method is called, a UnitTest object is constructed and returned. Consecutive calls will return the same object.

sect4.title: original_working_dir {#UnitTest::original_working_dir}
sect4.para: Returns the working directory when the first `TEST()` or `TEST_F()` was executed. The UnitTest object owns the string.

sect4.title: current_test_suite {#UnitTest::current_test_suite}
sect4.para: Returns the `TestSuite` object for the test that's currently running, or NULL if no test is running.

sect4.title: current_test_info {#UnitTest::current_test_info}
sect4.para: Returns the `TestInfo` object for the test that's currently running, or NULL if no test is running.

sect4.title: random_seed {#UnitTest::random_seed}
sect4.para: Returns the random seed used at the start of the current test run.

sect4.title: successful_test_suite_count {#UnitTest::successful_test_suite_count}
sect4.para: Gets the number of successful test suites.

sect4.title: failed_test_suite_count {#UnitTest::failed_test_suite_count}
sect4.para: Gets the number of failed test suites.

sect4.title: total_test_suite_count {#UnitTest::total_test_suite_count}
sect4.para: Gets the number of all test suites.

sect4.title: test_suite_to_run_count {#UnitTest::test_suite_to_run_count}
sect4.para: Gets the number of all test suites that contain at least one test that should run.

sect4.title: successful_test_count {#UnitTest::successful_test_count}
sect4.para: Gets the number of successful tests.

sect4.title: skipped_test_count {#UnitTest::skipped_test_count}
sect4.para: Gets the number of skipped tests.

sect4.title: failed_test_count {#UnitTest::failed_test_count}
sect4.para: Gets the number of failed tests.

sect4.title: reportable_disabled_test_count {#UnitTest::reportable_disabled_test_count}
sect4.para: Gets the number of disabled tests that will be reported in the XML report.

sect4.title: disabled_test_count {#UnitTest::disabled_test_count}
sect4.para: Gets the number of disabled tests.

sect4.title: reportable_test_count {#UnitTest::reportable_test_count}
sect4.para: Gets the number of tests to be printed in the XML report.

sect4.title: total_test_count {#UnitTest::total_test_count}
sect4.para: Gets the number of all tests.

sect4.title: test_to_run_count {#UnitTest::test_to_run_count}
sect4.para: Gets the number of tests that should run.

sect4.title: start_timestamp {#UnitTest::start_timestamp}
sect4.para: Gets the time of the test program start, in ms from the start of the UNIX epoch.

sect4.title: elapsed_time {#UnitTest::elapsed_time}
sect4.para: Gets the elapsed time, in milliseconds.

sect4.title: Passed {#UnitTest::Passed}
sect4.para: Returns true if and only if the unit test passed (i.e. all test suites passed).

sect4.title: Failed {#UnitTest::Failed}
sect4.para: Returns true if and only if the unit test failed (i.e. some test suite failed or something outside of all tests failed).

sect4.title: GetTestSuite {#UnitTest::GetTestSuite}
sect4.para: Gets the `TestSuite` object for the i-th test suite among all the test suites. i can range from 0 to total_test_suite_count() - 1. If i is not in that range, returns NULL.

sect4.title: ad_hoc_test_result {#UnitTest::ad_hoc_test_result}
sect4.para: Returns the `TestResult` containing information on test failures and properties logged outside of individual test suites.

sect4.title: listeners {#UnitTest::listeners}
sect4.para: Returns the list of event listeners that can be used to track events inside GoogleTest. See `TestEventListeners`.

sect2.title: TestEventListener
sect2.para: The interface for tracing execution of tests. The methods below are listed in the order the corresponding events are fired.

sect4.title: OnTestProgramStart {#TestEventListener::OnTestProgramStart}
sect4.para: Fired before any test activity starts.

sect4.title: OnTestIterationStart {#TestEventListener::OnTestIterationStart}

para.computeroutput: virtual void TestEventListener::OnTestIterationStart(const UnitTest& unit_test, int iteration)

sect4.para: Fired before each iteration of tests starts. There may be more than one iteration if GTEST_FLAG(repeat) is set. iteration is the iteration index, starting from 0.

sect4.title: OnEnvironmentsSetUpStart {#TestEventListener::OnEnvironmentsSetUpStart}
sect4.para: Fired before environment set-up for each iteration of tests starts.

sect4.title: OnEnvironmentsSetUpEnd {#TestEventListener::OnEnvironmentsSetUpEnd}
sect4.para: Fired after environment set-up for each iteration of tests ends.

sect4.title: OnTestSuiteStart {#TestEventListener::OnTestSuiteStart}
sect4.para: Fired before the test suite starts.

sect4.title: OnTestStart {#TestEventListener::OnTestStart}
sect4.para: Fired before the test starts.

sect4.title: OnTestPartResult {#TestEventListener::OnTestPartResult}
sect4.para: Fired after a failed assertion or a SUCCEED() invocation. If you want to throw an exception from this function to skip to the next test, it must be an `AssertionException` or inherited from it.

sect4.title: OnTestEnd {#TestEventListener::OnTestEnd}
sect4.para: Fired after the test ends.

sect4.title: OnTestSuiteEnd {#TestEventListener::OnTestSuiteEnd}
sect4.para: Fired after the test suite ends.

sect4.title: OnEnvironmentsTearDownStart {#TestEventListener::OnEnvironmentsTearDownStart}
sect4.para: Fired before environment tear-down for each iteration of tests starts.

sect4.title: OnEnvironmentsTearDownEnd {#TestEventListener::OnEnvironmentsTearDownEnd}
sect4.para: Fired after environment tear-down for each iteration of tests ends.

sect4.title: OnTestIterationEnd {#TestEventListener::OnTestIterationEnd}

para.computeroutput: virtual void TestEventListener::OnTestIterationEnd(const UnitTest& unit_test, int iteration)

sect4.para: Fired after each iteration of tests finishes.

sect4.title: OnTestProgramEnd {#TestEventListener::OnTestProgramEnd}
sect4.para: Fired after all test activities have ended.

sect2.title: TestEventListeners
sect2.para: Lets users add listeners to track events in GoogleTest.

sect4.title: Append {#TestEventListeners::Append}
sect4.para: Appends an event listener to the end of the list. GoogleTest assumes ownership of the listener (i.e. it will delete the listener when the test program finishes).

sect4.title: Release {#TestEventListeners::Release}
sect4.para: Removes the given event listener from the list and returns it. It then becomes the caller's responsibility to delete the listener. Returns NULL if the listener is not found in the list.

sect4.title: default_result_printer {#TestEventListeners::default_result_printer}
sect4.para: Returns the standard listener responsible for the default console output. Can be removed from the listeners list to shut down default console output. Note that removing this object from the listener list with `Release()` transfers its ownership to the caller and makes this function return NULL the next time.

sect4.title: default_xml_generator {#TestEventListeners::default_xml_generator}
sect4.para: Returns the standard listener responsible for the default XML output controlled by the --gtest_output=xml flag. Can be removed from the listeners list by users who want to shut down the default XML output controlled by this flag and substitute it with custom one. Note that removing this object from the listener list with `Release()` transfers its ownership to the caller and makes this function return NULL the next time.

sect2.title: TestPartResult
sect2.para: A copyable object representing the result of a test part (i.e. an assertion or an explicit FAIL(), ADD_FAILURE(), or SUCCESS()).

sect4.title: type {#TestPartResult::type}
sect4.para: Gets the outcome of the test part.
The return type Type is an enum defined as follows:

sect4.title: file_name {#TestPartResult::file_name}
sect4.para: Gets the name of the source file where the test part took place, or NULL if it's unknown.

sect4.title: line_number {#TestPartResult::line_number}
sect4.para: Gets the line in the source file where the test part took place, or -1 if it's unknown.

sect4.title: summary {#TestPartResult::summary}
sect4.para: Gets the summary of the failure message.

sect4.title: message {#TestPartResult::message}
sect4.para: Gets the message associated with the test part.

sect4.title: skipped {#TestPartResult::skipped}
sect4.para: Returns true if and only if the test part was skipped.

sect4.title: passed {#TestPartResult::passed}
sect4.para: Returns true if and only if the test part passed.

sect4.title: nonfatally_failed {#TestPartResult::nonfatally_failed}
sect4.para: Returns true if and only if the test part non-fatally failed.

sect4.title: fatally_failed {#TestPartResult::fatally_failed}
sect4.para: Returns true if and only if the test part fatally failed.

sect4.title: failed {#TestPartResult::failed}
sect4.para: Returns true if and only if the test part failed.

sect2.title: TestProperty
sect2.para: A copyable object representing a user-specified test property which can be output as a key/value string pair.

sect4.title: key
sect4.para: Gets the user-supplied key.

sect4.title: value
sect4.para: Gets the user-supplied value.

sect4.title: SetValue
sect4.para: Sets a new value, overriding the previous one.

sect2.title: TestResult
sect2.para: Contains information about the result of a single test.
TestResult is not copyable.

sect4.title: total_part_count {#TestResult::total_part_count}
sect4.para: Gets the number of all test parts. This is the sum of the number of successful test parts and the number of failed test parts.

sect4.title: test_property_count {#TestResult::test_property_count}
sect4.para: Returns the number of test properties.

sect4.title: Passed {#TestResult::Passed}
sect4.para: Returns true if and only if the test passed (i.e. no test part failed).

sect4.title: Skipped {#TestResult::Skipped}
sect4.para: Returns true if and only if the test was skipped.

sect4.title: Failed {#TestResult::Failed}
sect4.para: Returns true if and only if the test failed.

sect4.title: HasFatalFailure {#TestResult::HasFatalFailure}
sect4.para: Returns true if and only if the test fatally failed.

sect4.title: HasNonfatalFailure {#TestResult::HasNonfatalFailure}
sect4.para: Returns true if and only if the test has a non-fatal failure.

sect4.title: elapsed_time {#TestResult::elapsed_time}
sect4.para: Returns the elapsed time, in milliseconds.

sect4.title: start_timestamp {#TestResult::start_timestamp}
sect4.para: Gets the time of the test case start, in ms from the start of the UNIX epoch.

sect4.title: GetTestPartResult {#TestResult::GetTestPartResult}
sect4.para: Returns the `TestPartResult` for the i-th test part result among all the results. i can range from 0 to total_part_count() - 1. If i is not in that range, aborts the program.

sect4.title: GetTestProperty {#TestResult::GetTestProperty}
sect4.para: Returns the `TestProperty` object for the i-th test property. i can range from 0 to test_property_count() - 1. If i is not in that range, aborts the program.

sect2.title: TimeInMillis
sect2.para: An integer type representing time in milliseconds.

sect2.title: Types
sect2.para: Represents a list of types for use in typed tests and type-parameterized tests.
The template argument T... can be any number of types, for example:
See Typed Tests and Type-Parameterized Tests for more information.

sect2.title: WithParamInterface
sect2.para: The pure interface class that all value-parameterized tests inherit from.

A value-parameterized test fixture class must inherit from both `Test` and WithParamInterface. In most cases that just means inheriting from `TestWithParam`, but more complicated test hierarchies may need to inherit from Test and WithParamInterface at different levels.
This interface defines the type alias ParamType for the parameter type T and has support for accessing the test parameter value via the GetParam() method:
For more information, see Value-Parameterized Tests.

sect1.title: Functions
sect1.para: GoogleTest defines the following functions to help with writing and running tests.

sect2.title: InitGoogleTest
sect2.para: void testing::InitGoogleTest(int* argc, char** argv) \ void testing::InitGoogleTest(int* argc, wchar_t** argv) \ void testing::InitGoogleTest()

Initializes GoogleTest. This must be called before calling `RUN_ALL_TESTS()`. In particular, it parses the command line for the flags that GoogleTest recognizes. Whenever a GoogleTest flag is seen, it is removed from argv, and *argc is decremented.
No value is returned. Instead, the GoogleTest flag variables are updated.
The InitGoogleTest(int* argc, wchar_t** argv) overload can be used in Windows programs compiled in UNICODE mode.
The argument-less InitGoogleTest() overload can be used on Arduino/embedded platforms where there is no argc/argv.

sect2.title: AddGlobalTestEnvironment
sect2.para: Adds a test environment to the test program. Must be called before `RUN_ALL_TESTS()` is called. See Global Set-Up and Tear-Down for more information.
See also `Environment`.

sect2.title: RegisterTest
sect2.para: Dynamically registers a test with the framework.

The factory argument is a factory callable (move-constructible) object or function pointer that creates a new instance of the Test object. It handles ownership to the caller. The signature of the callable is Fixture*(), where Fixture is the test fixture class for the test. All tests registered with the same test_suite_name must return the same fixture type. This is checked at runtime.
The framework will infer the fixture class from the factory and will call the SetUpTestSuite and TearDownTestSuite methods for it.
Must be called before `RUN_ALL_TESTS()` is invoked, otherwise behavior is undefined.
See Registering tests programmatically for more information.

sect2.title: RUN_ALL_TESTS
sect2.para: Use this function in main() to run all tests. It returns 0 if all tests are successful, or 1 otherwise.
RUN_ALL_TESTS() should be invoked after the command line has been parsed by `InitGoogleTest()`.
This function was formerly a macro; thus, it is in the global namespace and has an all-caps name.

sect2.title: AssertionSuccess
sect2.para: Creates a successful assertion result. See `AssertionResult`.

sect2.title: AssertionFailure
sect2.para: Creates a failed assertion result. Use the << operator to store a failure message:
See `AssertionResult`.

sect2.title: StaticAssertTypeEq
sect2.para: Compile-time assertion for type equality. Compiles if and only if T1 and T2 are the same type. The value it returns is irrelevant.
See Type Assertions for more information.

sect2.title: PrintToString
sect2.para: Prints any value x using GoogleTest's value printer.
See Teaching GoogleTest How to Print Your Values for more information.

sect2.title: PrintToStringParamName
sect2.para: A built-in parameterized test name generator which returns the result of `PrintToString` called on info.param. Does not work when the test parameter is a std::string or C string. See Specifying Names for Value-Parameterized Test Parameters for more information.
See also `TestParamInfo` and `INSTANTIATE_TEST_SUITE_P`.
